description.narrative: IFC anticipates that this investment will strengthen sector sustainability and inclusiveness, through demonstration and replication channels. The development impacts are centered around: (i) Sustainability, by supporting the Company's climate smart interventions that reduce crop losses and spoilage, and increase productivity while reducing input use; (ii) Employment, whereby the Project is expected to create 130 new employees and provide skills training; (iii) The Company's stakeholders, namely their (a) suppliers through increased skills training and sales volumes, and (b) distributors/buyers through increases in the volume and quality of products to retail.

The proposed investment is an A loan of up to EUR4.0 million to Wildeklawer Group (the Group), to support the first phase of its expansion program, which includes: (i) expansion of carrot and beetroot packaging capacity; (ii) development of additional farmland; (iii) construction of an access road; and (iv) working capital needs.

name.narrative: The Group runs its farming and packing operations out of (i) Barkly West where it has about 2,500 ha of arable land on the banks of the Vaal River; and (ii) Hopetown where it has about 1,800 ha of arable land on the banks of the Orange River both in the Northern Cape Province of South Africa. The new investments under the project are planned to be made at the Groups headquarters in Barkly West, the Northern Cape, South Africa.
